caption: This photograph captures a tranquil ocean scene viewed from above, dominated by the vast, textured surface of the water. The ocean displays a gradient of colors ranging from a deep blue to a lighter turquoise, indicating variations in water depth or the presence of underwater features. The surface of the water is slightly rippled, suggesting a gentle breeze. There are no visible landforms, boats, or people; the image focuses solely on the natural patterns and hues of the sea. The lighting in the photograph suggests it could be taken during late afternoon, with subtle sunlight enhancing the serene blue tones of the water. The overall composition is simple yet thoughtful, emphasizing the expansive and undisturbed nature of the ocean.
title: Dumping area for acid wastes in the New York Bight near New York City. The U.S. Coast Guard is responsible for monitoring all ocean dumping in the bight which includes 15,000 square miles of ocean waters and the continental shelf off the coasts of New York and New Jersey. The National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Administration is conducting a marine ecosystems analysis program in the bight. The multi-year project is being observed by EPA and the Coast Guard.
